alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 23 at 12:03PM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Nevada... Humboldt River At Battle Mountain affecting Lander County. ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Wildhorse Reservoir at Wildhorse Dam affecting Elko County. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt any available high mountain snowpack. Levels at the Battle Mountain location along the Humboldt River are still elevated, but are forecast to decrease slowly over the weekend. At the Wildhorse Dam, current levels are expected to be maintained. For the Lower Humboldt...including Palisade, Battle Mountain, Comus...elevated river levels are forecast. For the Owyhee River...including Wildhorse Dam, Wildhorse, Mountain City...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Elevated levels continue due to snowmelt. * WHERE...Wildhorse Reservoir at Wildhorse Dam. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM PDT Friday the stage was 6205.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain steady below flood stage at 6205.3 feet. - Action stage is 6205.0 feet. - Flood stage is 6208.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 1145 AM PDT.
